page.title: 16MEMORIES OF THE 1940'S
page.content: We interviewed a man who has lived Stoke Ash for 64 years. This is what he told us about life 40+ years ago: FARMING-in the second world war they had horses the breed was Suffolk punch .They were used for farming. THE SECOND WORLD WAR-he can remember the day when about 300 Ameican aircraft flew over together. We learnt about rationing and shortages of food. HOMES-There was no electricity in Stoke Ash until 1957. They used to have to get the water from one of two pumps in the village. You can see one of these pumps next to the phone-box. A WHIRLWIND-He remembers a whirlwind that uprooted trees and smashed windows in a summerhouse. LIFE TODAY-He says that life is better today because he enjoys watching television.
